Wisdom: احْذَرِ الْأَحْمَقَ فَإِنَّ مُدَارَاتَهُ تُعَنِّيكَ وَمُوَافَقَتَهُ تُرْدِيكَ وَمُخَالَفَتَهُ تُؤْذِيكَ وَمُصَاحَبَتَهُ وَبَالٌ عَلَيْكَ
enWisdom: Be wary of the fool for verily, being amicable with him will bring you hardship (or exhaust you), agreeing with him will destroy you, disagreeing with him will cause you suffering and keeping his company will be [like] a curse upon you

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمُصَادَقَةَ [مُصَاحَبَةَ] الْأَحْمَقِ فَإِنَّهُ يُرِيدُ أَنْ يَنْفَعَكَ فَيَضُرُّكَ
enWisdom: Be careful not to befriend a fool, for he will harm you while trying to benefit you

Wisdom: إِيَّاكَ وَمَوَدَّةَ الْأَحْمَقِ فَإِنَّهُ يَضُرُّكَ مِنْ حَيْثُ يَرَى أَنَّهُ يَنْفَعُكَ وَيَسُوءُكَ وَهُوَ يَرَى أَنَّهُ يَسُرُّكَ
enWisdom: Be careful not to love the fool, for he will surely harm you while he thinks that he is benefitting you and will annoy you while he thinks that he is pleasing you

Wisdom: ثَلَاثٌ لَا يُسْتَوْدَعْنَ سِرّاً الْمَرْأَةُ وَالنَّمَّامُ وَالْأَحْمَقُ
enWisdom: Three people are not to be trusted with a secret: the woman, the telltale and the fool
Accompanying a fool is torment for the soul
The friend of a fool is in distress
Cutting off [ties with] the fool is judiciousness

Wisdom: كُنْ عَلَى حَذَرٍ مِنَ الْأَحْمَقِ إِذَا صَاحَبْتَهُ وَمِنَ الْفَاجِرِ إِذَا عَاشَرْتَهُ وَمِنَ الظَّالِمِ إِذَا عَامَلْتَهُ
enWisdom: Be cautious of the fool when you are in his company, of the vicious when you associate with him and of the oppressor when you deal with him

Wisdom: كُفْرُ النِّعْمَةِ لُؤْمٌ وَصُحْبَةُ الْأَحْمَقِ شُؤْمٌ
enWisdom: Ungratefulness for a blessing is vileness, and accompanying a fool is [a cause of] misfortune
One who enters the circle of dimwits is debased
Sitting with people of low morals wears out the hearts
Accompanying the dimwit corrupts one’s character
Putting up with a fool is a torment for the soul

Wisdom: لَا تَصْحَبِ الْمَائِقَ فَيُزَيِّنَ لَكَ فِعْلَهُ وَيَوَدَّ أَنَّكَ مِثْلُهُ
enWisdom: Never associate with one who has no intelligence

Wisdom: يَنْبَغِي أَنْ يُهَانَ مُغْتَنِمُ مَوَدَّةِ الْحَمْقَى
enWisdom: It is befitting for the person who values the friendship of a fool to be humiliated
